ratings.comment: Professor rambles on about what seems to be nothing, but pay attention this is what she tests on. Her exams are not based on what you really need to know about the revolution, rather minor people and social events. Also exam ? are mostly from readings. Horrible professor, never clear on what was expected from us.

very nice lady but sometimes could get off topic/jump around in lectures. one lecture devoted entirely to listening to rev war music. grading depends on your ta but discussion helps a lot in clarifying whats important. good notes come from lecture if you figure out whats important enough to write down. tests arent terrible if you study

attendance taken so go. classes generally boring so bring computer. she is a hard grader and expects good writing. she is very helpful if you go to her office hours. small papers due every week and a large term paper at the end.

Very knowledgeable on the American Revolution time period, although much of the material is focused on the politics before and after the war... I think only a couple lectures on the actual war.  Interesting stuff and fairly easy class.

This class is inaccurately titled. She needs to either refocus the class or rename it  "a social history of the 17th and 18th centuries".  The professor focused way to much on social aspects and her own book, rather then on the stuff I was hoping for and what the title suggests. Disorganized, class rarely started on time, which was nice.
I had to fight myself to not fall asleep in class. The tests were easy, though.

Her test aren't hard, but her lectures are terrible.  She jumps around from topic to topic and is really hard to understand.  The class doesn't talk about the war at all, its just a social history.  I love history but this class drove me nuts.

Some lectures dragged, but most were great. One of the only American history periods that leaves you with that pleasant, enchanted feel of our nation in relation to politics. :) I did about half of the readings, went to lecture, and did the assignments and the class is very easy for a 300 level. Always made me want to watch the Patriot.

Lee is annoying.  i hate lectures. Doesn't understand how to properly teach, jumps everywhere in her lectures, and doesn't put any faith or trust in the students.  For example, she has an outline for every lecture, but won't allow us access to it but for the three seconds she puts it up in class.  Also, she tells really bad jokes that aren't funny.

This class is terrible. The professor doesn't know how to teach, neither do the TAs, the material is disorganized, the focus is questionable. If you want an interesting class about the revolution, take Comm Arts 372.

There's no doubt she's very passionate about the American Revolution.  But there is so much reading for this class, and while interesting, it's tough to figure out which is important for tests.  I felt the TA's were unorganized, but in the end, if you really like the topic, it's probably worth a try
